item.title: Covid in Scotland: Travel rules simplified but test regime may stay
item.description: The green and amber lists will merge but the Scottish government will not drop testing requirements.

item.title: Four more small energy firms could go bust next week
item.description: Rising wholesale gas prices means some companies are unable to supply energy customers have paid for.

item.title: Man dies after being seriously hurt in Inverkeithing restaurant
item.description: A man has been arrested and charged in connection with the incident in Inverkeithing on Friday afternoon.

item.title: Boy, 9, needed major surgery after TikTok magnet trend
item.description: Surgeons had to remove Jack Mason's appendix, small bowel and 30cm of his large bowel after he swallowed tiny magnets.

item.title: Camanachd Cup final: Kinlochshiel defeat Lovat for first ever triumph
item.description: The Camanachd Cup heads to Wester Ross for the first time in its 125-year history as Kinlochshiel defeated Lovat 3-1 in Oban.

item.title: Scotland still has highest Covid infection rate in the UK
item.description: For the second week in a row Scotland was at the highest level of Covid cases since estimates began a year ago.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Soldiers to drive ambulances under military aid plan
item.description: The Scottish Ambulance Service confirms logistical staff will also be made available to help ease pressure on its crews.

item.title: Man jailed for murdering Wishaw teenager in scissor attack
item.description: Connor McMath sentenced to a minimum of 15 years for fatally stabbing Sean Ford in the neck in Wishaw.

item.title: St Andrews beats Oxford and Cambridge universities to top spot
item.description: The Fife institution beats Oxford and Cambridge to the top of the The Times and Sunday Times Good University Guide.

item.title: From council house to royal palace: My life as the Queen’s piper

item.title: SPFL chief voices 'huge concern' over vaccine passport checks

item.title: Hibernian 2-2 St Mirren: Hibs spurn chance to go top of table

item.title: Aberdeen 0-1 St Johnstone: Late Stevie May gives visitors first win
item.description: Stevie May's late goal gave St Johnstone a first Scottish Premiership win of the season and extended his old club Aberdeen's winless run to seven matches.

item.title: Ross County 2-2 Hearts: Kingsley's fine free-kick maintains visitors unbeaten start
item.description: Stephen Kingsley's superb second-half free-kick ensures Hearts maintain their unbeaten Scottish Premiership start as Ross County still search for a first league win under Malky Mackay.

item.title: Kelty striker Nathan Austin says he was racially abused after win at Albion Rovers
item.description: Kelty Hearts say an investigation is ongoing after striker Nathan Austin alleged he was racially abused in his side's League 2 win at Albion Rovers.

item.title: Hungary 0-2 Scotland: Losa 'proud' of players after earning debut win
